content.raw:
Looks like they moved away from uppercase version. The [cmake 3.2](https://cmake.org/cmake/help/v3.2/module/FindPackageHandleStandardArgs.html) version of the page says `the two possible names are FooBar_FOUND and FOOBAR_FOUND. It is recommended to use the original case version.`

In [cmake 3.5](https://cmake.org/cmake/help/v3.5/module/FindPackageHandleStandardArgs.html) it says `Result variables of both names are always set for compatibility.` 

Based on that I'd say the uppercase variable is for compatibility with old cmake code, which doesn't apply here.
content.html:
Looks like they moved away from uppercase version. The cmake 3.2 version of the page says the two possible names are FooBar_FOUND and FOOBAR_FOUND. It is recommended to use the original case version.

In cmake 3.5 it says Result variables of both names are always set for compatibility.

Based on that I'd say the uppercase variable is for compatibility with old cmake code, which doesn't apply here.
